title: Google discontinues Nest Protect smoke alarm and Nest x Yale door lock
snippets: Google has announced the discontinuation of two products: the Nest Protect Smart Smoke and CO alarm, and the Nest x Yale smart door lock. The Nest Protect, known as one of the best smart smoke alarms available, has been difficult to purchase recently.

title: Madison Square Garden’s surveillance system banned this fan over his T-shirt design
snippets: Frank Miller was banned for life from New York's Radio City Music Hall, preventing him from attending a concert there on his parents' wedding anniversary. The ban was enforced before he could pass through security.

title: Judge dismisses Samsung’s smart ring lawsuit against Oura
snippets: In June, Samsung sought a legal declaration to affirm that its unreleased Galaxy Ring did not violate five patents held by smart ring maker Oura. However, a judge has dismissed Samsung's lawsuit, ruling that Samsung's action was premature as there was no solid proof Oura intended to sue over patent infringement.
summary: In June, Samsung filed a lawsuit seeking confirmation that its upcoming Galaxy Ring didn't infringe on five patents owned by Oura, a maker of smart rings. A judge has dismissed the case, stating it was too early for such legal action because there was no concrete evidence that Oura planned to sue Samsung for patent infringement.

title: Nvidia RTX 5090 mobile GPU:  more efficient and a little faster

The company's latest laptop GPUs, led by the RTX 5090, have had a lukewarm debut but promise better efficiency for laptop gaming.

title: Amazon MGM Studios head Jennifer Salke steps down

This move was announced in an internal memo by Mike Hopkins, the head of Prime Video and Amazon MGM Studios. According to the memo, Amazon will not seek a replacement for Salke's role as part of its organizational strategy.
summary: Jennifer Salke is stepping down as the head of Amazon MGM Studios to start a career in producing. Mike Hopkins, leader of Prime Video and Amazon MGM Studios, shared this news in an internal memo, stating that Amazon has decided not to look for a replacement for Salke, aligning with the company's organizational strategy.

title: A genetic tree as a movie: Moving beyond the still portrait of ancestry
snippets: Researchers have developed a statistical method that allows individuals to visualize their family tree in a dynamic, movie-like format, showing the geographical movement of ancestors over time. This innovative approach can also be applied to model the spread of diseases and track animal migration across different regions.
summary: Researchers have created a new statistical method that enables people to see their family tree as a dynamic visual, illustrating ancestors' movements over time. This method can also model disease spread and track animal migration.

title: Melting ice, more rain drive Southern Ocean cooling
snippets: Researchers have discovered that 60% of the discrepancy between expected and actual ocean temperatures around Antarctica over several decades is due to increased meltwater and rainfall in the area.
summary: Researchers found that 60% of the gap between predicted and actual ocean temperatures around Antarctica is caused by rising levels of meltwater and rainfall in the region over recent decades.

title: Cartilage and bone development: Three paths to skeleton formation
snippets: Researchers have found that in vertebrates, skeletal cells from different body regions not only originate from various precursor cells but also display distinct gene regulation patterns. This discovery highlights a potential factor in the evolutionary success of vertebrates.
summary: Researchers have discovered that in vertebrates, skeletal cells from different parts of the body come from various precursor cells and show unique patterns of gene regulation. This finding may explain a key aspect of vertebrates' evolutionary success.

title: Terahertz imaging: Breakthrough in non-invasive cochlear visualization
snippets: Researchers have developed a new method using terahertz (THz) imaging to non-invasively visualize the cochlear structures in mice, enabling high-resolution diagnostics. This technology allows for 3D reconstructions of the inner ear, promising advancements in diagnosing hearing loss and other medical conditions. The potential for creating miniaturized THz devices, such as endoscopes and otoscopes, could revolutionize the diagnosis of hearing loss, cancer, and more, improving diagnostic speed, accuracy, and patient outcomes.
summary: Researchers have created a new non-invasive technique using terahertz imaging to visualize the cochlear structures in mice, allowing for 3D inner ear reconstructions. This method could lead to advancements in diagnosing hearing loss and other conditions, with the potential for developing miniaturized devices like endoscopes and otoscopes to enhance diagnostic accuracy and patient care.

title: We must not ignore eugenics in our genetics curriculum, says professor

summary: Mark Peifer, a biology professor at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, promotes teaching eugenics in college genetics courses. He argues this approach will help scientists counter the misuse of science for political purposes.
